column4: hi all.  i am really struggling to understand what my issue is with ubuntu and my wifi.  I am connected to wireless at 100MB/s yet transfer to the usb drive which is connected to the router is almost at dialup modem speed.  refer http://i.imgur.com/6pggC.png .  only 2 computers connected to the network, and my wifes is not using internet other than google docs she is workin on
Sorry to ask as you probably have already checked, but is this issue only on ubuntu or have you checked from other computers with windows?
macbook is much quicker.  going about 2-3MB/s
both computers connected to the 2.4GHz of the router.  is a Netgear WNDR3700V2, so should be pretty capable.
Try connecting your ubuntu computer to the router with an ethernet cable to see if the issue isolates to your wireless card
1 minute to transfer file.  I am using broadcom proprietary driver on Acer 4655G
so must be the wifi.  could it be linked to power saving on the wifi when on battery?  let me plug into power to test
the problem is interesting, I'm assuming you have no issues downloading things that are not local to your network, like a torrent or something?
internet was a little slow.  just plugged into power, and now the file transfer on wifi is 3.3MB/s
research a way to disable the power saver on your wifi, not optimal but I'm not sure otherwise, maybe submit a bug report in the meantime, but boot into windows to test it first
could just be an issue with that particular model
Thanks.  I bought my machine without Windows, to prove to my wife that Ubuntu can work for day to day needs (she uses a Mac).  will look into the powersave
and you must win!  the wife must not know of the bug!
agree...  but i had to borrow the mac to test the transfer... so too late.  I just wish nvidia would support optimus on my machine... would make things so much easier...
I heard about that while reading through the steam linux blog, sounds like a damn headache

If you find time, take a look here:  http://blogs.valvesoftware.com/linux/faster-zombies/#comments  It may give you some insight or clues as to the optimus issues, there was some communication about it
